result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas M Nielsen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Nicholas M Nielsen is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Nicholas M Nielsen was found guilty of Battery by Prisoners, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.20(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant, Nicholas M Nielsen with Attorney Donna Burger appeared.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew John Maki.  Kim Silvius - Clerk
(3:07)
Burger - have it resolved but it would be a plea to felony and haven't gone over plea questionaire
BREAK FOR DA TO GET INFORMATION AND GO OVER PLEA QUESTIONAIRE
(3:30) recalled
State - agreement - deft waive prelim - will file Information
Deft - waives prelim hearing
State files Information
State - plea to Ct 1 - dismiss Ct 2 - w/held sent 2 yrs prob concurrent 30 days jail consecutive $268 cc, $250 dna surchg - no request for restitution

Deft - Ct 1 pleads guilty - waives rights & JT
State - victim rights have been complied with

COURT:  waiver of prelim voluntary - finds probable cause for bind over
Ct 1 - plea voluntary - finds deft guilty
w/held sentence 2 yrs probation - concurrent
$268 cc
$250 dna surchg  
PAYMENT PLAN***
  CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
30 days jail consecutive to any other jail time currently doing

DISMISS:  Ct 2

Defendant, Nicholas M Nielsen, in custody, appeared with Attorney Donna Burger.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew John Maki.  Defendant in custody.  Kim Silvius - Clerk
(11:49)  MULTIPLE CASES HEARD.
Sentencing on 15CF235 - Initial appearance on 15CF345
State - 15CF235 - argues sentence - requests what the PSI indicates; 36-48 months probation with conditional jail time up to six months - submit DNA sample and surchg, complete six mo jail, MRT, AODA programming, comply with all other requirements  $268 $250 no request for restitution
Burger - no changes or inaccuracies - argues sentence - has been sitting since mid June - attended programming in jail; therapy course and love and logic, attending substance abuse behavior course - also recommending the PSI recommendation - requests huber to seek work and treatment - plans to live with his mother
Deft - addresses the court

COURT:
Ct 1 - 4 yrs probation
$268 cc
$250 surchg
$  10 drug surchg
***PAYMENT PLAN***
  CONDITIONS OF PROBATION
6 months jail - huber allowed for seeking work and treatment - starts forthwith
MRT
AODA programming
comply with all other requirements of DOC
credit 148 days if revoked

15CF345 - Deft waives reading - speedy prelim - requests pretrial/return dates - requests modification of bond

COURT:  Modifies bond to $200 sign bond no contact continue with David Berg 
PTC January 5, 2016 at 2:45 p.m.
